posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content:
Welcome to our little corner of the woods!

I would shuffle the pre-epic feats: Blind fight and Point Blank Shot at level 1, Two-Weapon Fighting and Ambidexterity at levels 8 and 9, and Toughness at level 18.

Another (optional) idea would be to single-wield a rapier instead of dual-wielding shortswords, and use the 2 freed-up feats for Improved Critical on both weapons (obviously not at level 1).

If you take 2 more Fighter levels, you would trade an AA feat for a Fighter feat. If you take the 12th Fighter level when you get a general feat, you could get Epic Weapon Spec on both weapons. You would lose 1 AB and 1 AC from the loss of 2 DEX, and another AB from the loss of 2 levels of AA (leaving a still-impressive 59 AB), but you would gain a net 3 damage on the bow and 4 damage on the sword.

posts.author: Demos
posts.content: Another option is starting with 10 STR, 20 DEX and 8 WIS.  Replace the FTR 10 feats with the EWS feats, and replace 2 Great DEX's with Epic Prowess and Armor Skin.

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
This build demonstrates the insanely high ranged AB you can get from the Enchant arrow feat of the AA class.
It also demonstrates that you can get a very high Dexterity when a class has Great Dexterity as an epic bonus feat.
The high Dexterity enables a melee AB of 46, which is very good.
The high Dexterity also improves the AC and compensates in part for the lack of Tumble as class feat. The AC is better in robes (29) than in full plate (25). Unfortunately, none of the classes provide Uncanny dodge.

Melee is a serious back up plan for this build. You have TWF and Ambidexterity, but not ITWF. Called shot and Improved Critical are also feats to have. You can live well without Toughness and Iron will. But you have to prioritize. The 9 pre epic Fighter levels only give you 5 extra feats. 
I agree with taking str 14 for added damage with the swords and with mighty bows. The wizard level let you use arcane scrolls and wands without UMD. You can buff your swords with GMW and Flame weapon for better damage. Stoneskins, Improved invisibility and damage shields can add to the melee defence.
I agree with the other posters about adding the EWS feats. EWS is ironically enough probably most useful for the melee weapon, since this is a dex build and since the EA feat adds damage to the ranged attacks.

As for the skills, I guess that concentration and discipline end on 30 because of the last fighter Level at 27. A discipline of 30 will not help you much. With most dexers you must rely on a high AC, rather than the discipline skill, because the skill will not be high enough even with full ranks.
The concentration skill will protect you against taunts, but not from taunters with a high skill.
Tumble is maxed x-class as it should be.
I would have maxed Listen or Spot, maybe both if I had enough skill points to spend.
You seem a bit undecided about the stealth skills.
If you invest 13 points in Spellcraft at Level 10, you will get a +3 to saves vs spells.
You spend 58 points on Lore and Heal. I would have put them elsewhere.

Overall an archer build with great potential!

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content: A pity to have all that AB and no rapid-shot, you are almost guaranteed to hit with all of your attacks so the more you have the better. I would replace toughness with it in a heartbeat. Another possibility is to think when you are going to need to switch into your melee weapon(s), normally an archer would do that when he needs defence above all else. I would go with a rapier & shield setup in that case and this way you can keep toughness as well as take rapid-shot & knockdown so that you have something to do with all that AB. Or you can go all-out & take rapid-shot & Improved knockdown which will make your archer into a formidable warrior in both blade & bow.

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
A further thought ( hello, by the way!), that merely echoes some previous comments. If you take Ambidexterity an Two-Weapon Fighting at level 1 and actually dual-wield, you'd be starting with negative AB, and that can't be good. It'd be like flailing around blind with two spoons. These days, I wouldn't think about dual-wielding until just before or after level 10, when your AB is high enough to deal with the -2 to both hands without too much concern.

I do understand that thematically excellence with both bow and twin blades is very Legolas, but there are more productive feats you can take at early levels to make life easier - such as PBS, Blind Fight, Rapid Shot - even KD or Expertise for when you're in melee.

And I certainly wouldn't want to be in melee with a mage behind the mob with such a horrid Will save - and Iron Will wouldn't help much. I'd think you'd want to be doing the shooty stuff there, so maybe go bow before sword? (But that's just personal preference.)

Cheers, and good to meet you!

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content: I agree with going with archery first, and the idea of rapier-and-shield, but I disagree with the idea of Knockdown. Knocking down an opponent (which can only be done with melee) makes it harder to hit with a ranged attack. I'd take Point Blank Shot and Weapon Focus Longbow at level 1, and then Weapon Finesse, then Weapon Focus Rapier, then Weapon Spec Longbow, then Blind Fight and Weapon Spec Rapier, and then Rapid Shot at level 8. I would then move 2 Fighter levels from pre-epic to epic, and use that Fighter feat for Armor Skin. Basically, with all that shuffling around, you would be swapping Two Weapon Fighting and Ambidexterity for Rapid Shot and Armor Skin, and switching from dual shortswords to rapier-and-shield.
